results.title: Flash Gordon. Vol. 01
results.brief_description: Episodes one to six of this cult movie serial. Episode 1: “The Planet of peril”. Flash (Larry “Buster” Crabbe), Dale Arden (Jean Rogers) and Dr. Zarkov (Frank Shannon) are captured by Ming the Merciless (Charles Middleton) ruler of the planet, Mongo. Bent on galactic conquest, Ming stops at nothing in his attempt to destroy the Earth. Zarkov is forced to work in Ming’s lab and Flash finds himself wrestling with three fanged men. Episode 2: “The Tunnel of terror”. Dale is subjected to Ming’s “dehumanizer” in order to marry her. Thun of the Lion-Men joins forces with Flash and together they sneak into the Palace and find Zarkov. Flash races to save Dale only to be confronted with the Fire Dragon. Episode 3: “Captured by sharkmen”. After falling through a trap door, Flash and Dale land in an underground river and are taken prisoner by the Sharkmen. Betrayed by their ruler, Kala, Flash becomes entombed in a flooding tank - occupied by Octosak. Episode 4: “Battling the sea beast”. Aura and Thun arrive just in time to save Flash with their ray guns but the underwater city’s controls are destroyed and water starts to flood in. Episode 5: “The Destroying ray”. Using a ray to counteract the magnetic power that holds Kala’s Shark Palace underwater, Ming raises the underwater city to the surface. Enter Prince Barin, true ruler of Mongo who befriends Zarkov. Together they head off to rescue Flash, only to encounter the evil Hawk Men. Episode 6: “Flaming torture”. Flash soon discovers that the planet Mongo is a melting pot of evil leaders when he’s taken prisoner by yet another: Vultan. Flash faces execution in the dreaded “Static Room”…

results.title: Flash Gordon [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Mike Hodges, Dino De Laurentiis, Starling Films, De Laurentiis Entertainment Group and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: A fast paced, campy remake of the original 1936 Flash Gordon serial (315687) replete with a fierce rock score by Queen. An unseen force from outer space is causing all sorts of freak meteorological events. Flash (Sam Jones), quarterback of the New York Jets, and reporter Dale Arden (Melody Anderson) become reluctant passengers to outer-space when Zarkov (Topol), a discredited NASA scientist believes the Earth is being invaded by hostile aliens. Soon all are bound for the Planet Mongo, hurtling through a convenient Black Hole…there they have to find out who is causing all this extra-terrestrial trouble before the earth destructs. Captured by Ming the Merciless (Max Von Sydow) and hopelessly outnumbered by his slave minions, Flash must make allies of the flying Hawk Men led by Vultan (Brian Blessed) and the fierce Tree Men of Arboria ruled by the dashing Prince Barin (Timothy Dalton) before he can save Earth. Cast also includes Ornella Muti, Mariangelo Melato, Peter Wyngarde. Based on characters created by Alex Raymond in 1934.

results.title: Flare: a ski trip
results.creator_credit: Sam Neill, Tom Williamson and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: A team of six skiers returning to New Zealand demonstrate freestyle skiing. The three basic Freestyle skills; Ballet, Jumping and Moguls or Bumps are shown in North and South Island Skifields. The film culminates in a skier’s dream - to ski the untracked slopes of a live volcano.

results.title: Flare of the sun
results.brief_description: New Zealand’s contribution to the International Geophysical Year, 1957-1958, as exemplified in the tracking of sunspots and the consequent interruptions to radio signals. The extent of New Zealand’s observations; routine work at stations from Antarctica to the Pacific; the elaborate international communications system for tracing a sunspot and warning radio channels. A picture of scientific cooperation on an international scale.

results.title: Flank Breeder
results.brief_description: The myopic Flank Breeder trundles through life filling a small home with small deeds. The world at large is of no consequence…until the accident. A pedestrian duck lays stricken on Flank Breeder’s doorstep. A time has come for action, to quickly lend a hand, but so imprinted is Flank by a small world and its demands, that he finds himself unable to rise to the situation. Script and animation by Bruce Currie.

results.title: Flamingo Park
results.creator_credit: Clytie Jessop, Women's Film Fund (Australia) and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: Shows the works of two artistic and talented Australian fashion designers. Jenny Kee’s colourful designs are inspired by the tones of the bush, birds and flora, whilst Linda Jackson’s inspiration comes from the ocean and the sealife. Jenny’s designs are made up into outstandingly colourful handknitted garments, whilst Linda uses chiffons, cottons and appliqued designs.

results.title: Flaming star
results.creator_credit: Don Siegel, David Weisbart and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Considered one of Elvis Presley’s most dramatic roles, “Flaming Star” is a story about Pacer Burton’s (Presley) struggle as a young man torn between two cultures. Set some years after the Civil War, the small community that Pacer lives in finds itself under siege from the Kiowa tribe. After several settlers are killed the community turns on Pacer and his family and Pacer is forced to choose between the community he grew up in and his Native American roots. His choice leads to tragedy for both sides. “Flaming Star” enables Presley to showcase his acting ability without the usual musical intermissions. Cast also includes Dolores Del Rio, John McIntire and Barbara Eden. Features the original theatrical trailer.

results.title: Flamenco at 5.15
results.creator_credit: Cynthia Scott, Kathleen Shannon, Adam Symansky and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: FLAMENCO AT 5.15 is a visual and emotional thriller. It is an impressionistic record of a flamenco dance class given to senior students of the National Ballet School of Canada by two great teachers from Spain, Susana and Antonio Robledo. The film shows the beautiful young North American dancers inspired by the flamenco rhythms and mesmerised by Susana’s extraordinary energy, joyously merging with an ancient gypsy culture. (Awards: Academy Award, Hollywood; Salerno; San Francisco; Cracow; Valladolid; Yorkton; New York)

results.title: Flamenco [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Carlos Saura, Juan Lebron, Canal+, Sogepaq, Radio Television de Andalucia (RTVA) and Juan Lebron Producciones
results.brief_description: This Spanish documentary is a tribute to flamenco dancing, singing, guitar playing and music, presented in all its glorious pageantry, passion and colour. Carlos Saura amasses an impressive range of artists, over 300, who sing, dance and play music, expressing stories with fervour, dignity and evident respect for the tradition of flamenco art. With little dialogue, narratives are expressed through rumba, tango, ballet, taranta, song and music, in a variety of moods and styles, often in small collaborations but also in groups of twenty or more. A minimalist setting, the old Plaza de Armas train station in Seville, is transformed into an impromptu space, beautifully photographed with dramatic lighting highlighting the sense of theatre, drawing attention to expressive performances. These performers, who vary in age from children to the elderly, give an extraordinary recital, which embraces and celebrates culture. Includes: Paco de Lucia, Manolo Sanlucar, Lole Manuel, Jose Menese, Jose Merce, Mario Maya, Belen Maya, Carmen Linares, Manolo Sanlucar, Maria Pages, Joaquin Cortes, Juana la del Revuelo, Matilde Coral, Enrique Morente, Aurora Vargas, La Paquera de Jerez, Paco Toronjo, Paco de Lucia, Fernanda de Utrera, Merche Esmeralda, Remedies Amaya, Moratio Chico, Nino Jero and Paco del Gastor. Please note, singing is in Spanish with no subtitles.

results.title: Flags = Zastave
results.creator_credit: Zoran Jovanovic, Nancy Karkowsky and Neoplanta Film
results.brief_description: Zoran Jovanovic, in simple line drawings, explores man’s complex relationship to one of his most important symbols - the flag. Only women, Jovanovic implies, see the flag not as symbol but as fabric. Animation by Predrag Pantovic and Slavomir Calic.
